Uses of Class
rlu.foundation.exceptions.EncryptionException

Packages that use EncryptionException
rlu.foundation.security Contains useful classes for implementing security functionality. 
rlu.sqltrainer.application Contains application classes which provide a user interface independent API for the SQLTrainer. 
rlu.sqltrainer.domain Covers aspects of domain objects, which are relevant for the SQL Trainer. 
 

Uses of EncryptionException in rlu.foundation.security
 

Methods in rlu.foundation.security that throw EncryptionException
abstract  java.lang.String Encrypter.decrypt(java.lang.String str)
          Abstract interface method, which has to be overridden by implementations.
 java.lang.String DesEncrypter.decrypt(java.lang.String str)
          Decrypts the given string, using the DES algorihm.
 java.lang.String SecureHashService.encrypt(java.lang.String plaintext)
          Uses MD5 to compute a hash value for the given text.
abstract  java.lang.String Encrypter.encrypt(java.lang.String str)
          Abstract interface method, which has to be overridden by implementations.
 java.lang.String DesEncrypter.encrypt(java.lang.String str)
          Encrypts the given string, using the DES algorihm.
static Encrypter Encrypter.getInstance()
          Uses reflection to look for a concrete implementation of the encryption interface.
 

Uses of EncryptionException in rlu.sqltrainer.application
 

Methods in rlu.sqltrainer.application that throw EncryptionException
 Feedback SQLTrainer.provideFeedback()
          Creates a feedback for the current exercise or for the whole exercise set if currExerciseIdx is -1.
 Feedback SQLTrainer.provideFeedback(int exerciseIdx)
          Executes the answer of the specified exercise (an SQL statement) on the database server and also the solution of the specified exercise and asks the used feedback strategy for a feedback.
 

Uses of EncryptionException in rlu.sqltrainer.domain
 

Methods in rlu.sqltrainer.domain that throw EncryptionException
private  void ExerciseSet.changeEncryptionStatus(boolean encrypt)
          Modifies the contents of the solution strings and the solution hash value as specified.
 java.lang.String ExerciseSet.getDecryptedSolution(int exerciseIdx)
          Tries to get an unencrypted version of the solution which is maintained for the exercise with the specified index.
 void ExerciseSet.lock(java.lang.String passwd)
          Encrypts all solution texts and stores a hash value of the provided password with the exercise set.
 void ExerciseSet.unlock(java.lang.String passwd)
          Checks whether the hash value of the provided password equals the hash value stored for the password within the exercise set, and tries to decrypt the solution texts afterwards if the password proved to be correct.
